NORP In DATE ORG activity in the area where the applicants’ villages were located was at its peak and frequent armed clashes were taking place between ORG members and the NORP security forces . The applicants and other residents of their CARDINAL villages had refused to become village guards and the security forces believed that the ORG was being assisted by them .

CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) . According to a report prepared by ORG , CARDINAL villages had been evacuated in east and south - east GPE DATE andCARDINAL .

CARDINAL . In TIME of CARDINAL DATE most male residents of the applicants’ CARDINAL villages were working in the fields outside the villages . As the weather was sunny , most of the children were playing outside . The women and the elderly were either in their homes or sitting on the terraces outside their houses . When they first heard aircraft flying nearby at TIME they did not get scared because military planes and helicopters often flew in the area for reconnaissance and bombing missions against the ORG on the mountains . CARDINAL . DATE , however , military planes and a helicopter circled the applicants’ CARDINAL villages and then started to bomb them . The men working in the nearby fields ran to the village and tried to rescue people from underneath the rubble .

CARDINAL . As a result , CARDINAL people in LOC and CARDINAL people in GPE village lost their lives . Most of those who were killed were children , women or elderly . CARDINAL . The bombing from the aircraft continued in the surrounding areas . Although the local gendarmerie and local prosecutors became aware of the bombing , they did not go to the applicants’ villages to establish the identities of the deceased and to carry out post - mortem examinations . No national authority offered the villagers any help . Villagers from the nearby GPE village went to the applicants’ villages and helped the surviving villagers to take their injured relatives to hospitals in their tractors .
CARDINAL . The surviving residents of NORP village put the remains of their deceased relatives in plastic bags and buried them in a mass grave without any religious ceremony .
CARDINAL . As the village of LOC was located close to a main road , the villagers there were able to take the bodies of their relatives to the nearby GPE village and bury them in the cemetery there .

CARDINAL . After having buried their dead , all surviving villagers quickly abandoned their villages and what was left of their houses and belongings , and moved to different parts of the country . Some of them stayed behind but settled in the nearby GPE village . The applicants’ CARDINAL villages are still uninhabited .
